p: Camellia oleifera is one of the most important woody oil species in China and has very high economic value 1. The fruit is the main source of the economic benefits of Camellia oleifera, and how to achieve high yield, quality and efficiency of the species and its fruit has become an important research area 39. The fruit is a plant reproductive organ that develops from the ovary or other parts of the flower (such as receptacle, calyx, etc.) by pistils after pollination fertilization 40. The growth and development of fruit include the whole process from fertilization to fruit growth, maturation and senescence, and it is also the process of continuously accumulating and transforming nutrients and fruit morphogenesis construction 41. During the fruit growth and development process, the accumulation of nutrients mainly includes carbohydrates, proteins and lipids, most of which are transported by other organs of the plant, such as roots and leaves, while carbohydrate metabolism is the basis of regulation in its process 42, 43. During the early stages of Camellia oleifera fruit development, carbohydrates come from the photosynthesis of leaves and fruits 44.
